verses.verse: The words<WH1697> of king<WH4428> Lemuel,<WH3927> the prophecy<WH4853> that<WH834> his mother<WH517> taught<WH3256> him.
What, <WH4100> my son?<WH1248> and what,<WH4100> the son<WH1248> of my womb?<WH990> and what,<WH4100> the son<WH1248> of my vows?<WH5088>
Give <WH5414> not<WH408> thy strength<WH2428> unto women,<WH802> nor thy ways<WH1870> to that which destroyeth<WH4229> kings.<WH4428>
It is not<WH408> for kings,<WH4428> O Lemuel,<WH3927> it is not<WH408> for kings<WH4428> to drink<WH8354> wine;<WH3196> nor<WH176> for princes<WH7336> strong drink: <WH7941>
Lest <WH6435> they drink,<WH8354> and forget<WH7911> the law,<WH2710> and pervert<WH8138> the judgment<WH1779> of any<WH3605> of the afflicted.<WH1121> <WH6040>
Give <WH5414> strong drink<WH7941> unto him that is ready to perish,<WH6> and wine<WH3196> unto those that be of heavy<WH4751> hearts.<WH5315>
Let him drink,<WH8354> and forget<WH7911> his poverty,<WH7389> and remember<WH2142> his misery<WH5999> no<WH3808> more.<WH5750>
Open <WH6605> thy mouth<WH6310> for the dumb<WH483> in<WH413> the cause<WH1779> of all<WH3605> such as are appointed<WH1121> to destruction.<WH2475>
Open <WH6605> thy mouth,<WH6310> judge<WH8199> righteously,<WH6664> and plead the cause<WH1777> of the poor<WH6041> and needy.<WH34>
Who <WH4310> can find<WH4672> a virtuous<WH2428> woman?<WH802> for her price<WH4377> is far<WH7350> above rubies.<WH4480> <WH6443>
The heart<WH3820> of her husband<WH1167> doth safely trust<WH982> in her, so that he shall have no<WH3808> need<WH2637> of spoil.<WH7998>
She will do<WH1580> him good<WH2896> and not<WH3808> evil<WH7451> all<WH3605> the days<WH3117> of her life.<WH2416>
She seeketh<WH1875> wool,<WH6785> and flax,<WH6593> and worketh<WH6213> willingly<WH2656> with her hands.<WH3709>
She is<WH1961> like the merchants'<WH5503> ships;<WH591> she bringeth<WH935> her food<WH3899> from afar.<WH4480> <WH4801>
She riseth<WH6965> also while it is yet<WH5750> night,<WH3915> and giveth<WH5414> meat<WH2964> to her household,<WH1004> and a portion<WH2706> to her maidens.<WH5291>
She considereth<WH2161> a field,<WH7704> and buyeth<WH3947> it: with the fruit<WH4480> <WH6529> of her hands<WH3709> she planteth<WH5193> a vineyard.<WH3754>
She girdeth<WH2296> her loins<WH4975> with strength,<WH5797> and strengtheneth<WH553> her arms.<WH2220>
She perceiveth<WH2938> that<WH3588> her merchandise<WH5504> is good:<WH2896> her candle<WH5216> goeth not out<WH3808> <WH3518> by night.<WH3915>
She layeth<WH7971> her hands<WH3027> to the spindle,<WH3601> and her hands<WH3709> hold<WH8551> the distaff.<WH6418>
She stretcheth out<WH6566> her hand<WH3709> to the poor;<WH6041> yea, she reacheth forth<WH7971> her hands<WH3027> to the needy.<WH34>
She is not<WH3808> afraid<WH3372> of the snow<WH4480> <WH7950> for her household:<WH1004> for<WH3588> all<WH3605> her household<WH1004> are clothed<WH3847> with scarlet.<WH8144>
She maketh<WH6213> herself coverings of tapestry;<WH4765> her clothing<WH3830> is silk<WH8336> and purple.<WH713>
Her husband<WH1167> is known<WH3045> in the gates,<WH8179> when he sitteth<WH3427> among<WH5973> the elders<WH2205> of the land.<WH776>
She maketh<WH6213> fine linen,<WH5466> and selleth<WH4376> it; and delivereth<WH5414> girdles<WH2289> unto the merchant.<WH3669>
Strength <WH5797> and honor<WH1926> are her clothing;<WH3830> and she shall rejoice<WH7832> in time<WH3117> to come.<WH314>
She openeth<WH6605> her mouth<WH6310> with wisdom;<WH2451> and in<WH5921> her tongue<WH3956> is the law<WH8451> of kindness.<WH2617>
She looketh well<WH6822> to the ways<WH1979> of her household,<WH1004> and eateth<WH398> not<WH3808> the bread<WH3899> of idleness.<WH6104>
Her children<WH1121> arise up,<WH6965> and call her blessed;<WH833> her husband<WH1167> also, and he praiseth<WH1984> her.
Many <WH7227> daughters<WH1323> have done<WH6213> virtuously,<WH2428> but thou<WH859> excellest<WH5927> <WH5921> them all.<WH3605>
Favor <WH2580> is deceitful,<WH8267> and beauty<WH3308> is vain:<WH1892> but a woman<WH802> that feareth<WH3373> the LORD,<WH3068> she<WH1931> shall be praised.<WH1984>
Give <WH5414> her of the fruit<WH4480> <WH6529> of her hands;<WH3027> and let her own works<WH4639> praise<WH1984> her in the gates.<WH8179>
